back: Causes bacterial wilt in a very wide range of potential host plants
Known as southern wilt, bacterial wilt, brown rot of potato, and Granville wilt when it occurs in tobacco

source: Clemson University - USDA Cooperative Extension Slide Series

back: Causes fireblight of apples and pears
Large epiphytic populations on stigmas of flowers leads to infection
The primary foliar disease of winter wheat in most western European countries
Causes necrotic blotches on wheat leaves
A major fungal pathogen of wheat
Causes glume blotch or Septoria nodorum blotch

source: Clemson University - USDA Cooperative Extension Slide Series, Bugwood.org

back: Causes chlorotic needles and decreased needle retention in Doug Fir
Native to the western United States
Can infect a wide range of species
Causes ice nucleation in plants and the atmosphere
Causes bacterial fruit and leaf speck of tomato
Causes fusarium head blight on wheat and barley
Causes shifts in the amino acid composition of wheat, shriveled kernels, and mycotoxins

source: flickr user: International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center

back: Causes head scab disease on wheat and barley
Causes damping off of soybean seedlings
Causes stem and root rot of soybean
Overwinters in plant debris and soil
Soybean is the only known crop host
